p: In 2009, the isolation of infectious MARV was reported from healthy Egyptian rousettes ( Rousettus aegyptiacus or Egyptian fruit bat) (Towner etÂ al. 2009). This isolation, together with the isolation of infectious RAVV, strongly suggests that Old World fruit bats are involved in the natural maintenance of marburgviruses. Further studies are necessary to establish whether Egyptian rousettes are the actual hosts of MARV and RAVV or whether they get infected via contact with another animal and therefore serve only as intermediate hosts.
